start_here_page_marketplace.title: Marketplace
start_here_page_marketplace.content.0.de: Sell your products in one of the biggest marketplaces in the world through the native VTEX integration.
start_here_page_marketplace.content.1.de: Sell your products in one of the biggest marketplaces in Brasil through the native VTEX integration.
start_here_page_marketplace.content.2.de: Advertise your products with Facebook Business Extension through VTEX.
start_here_page_marketplace.content.3.de: Advertise your products on Google's price comparison and tracking service through VTEX native integration.
start_here_page_marketplace.content.4.ti: How to campaign through Google Shopping Ads?
start_here_page_marketplace.content.4.de: Advertise on Google Shopping Ads using Google's newest feature, Smart Campaigns. Start advertising in minutes using your product catalog.
start_here_page_marketplace.content.5.de: Centralize, optimize and track the distribution of your product catalog using the leading e-commerce feed management platform in Europe.
start_here_page_marketplace.content.6.de: Sell ​​your products on one of the largest social networks in the world through the native integration of VTEX.
start_here_page_marketplace.content.7.de: Advertise your products on TikTok through VTEX.
start_here_page_marketplace.content.8.de: Sell your products on the marketplace platform with Brazil's biggest rewards program.

start_here_page_payment.content.2.descri: A digital wallet (also known as an ewallet) is a secure environment where bank and credit card information can be stored.

app_development_page_new_to_app_developm: Build stores and IO apps from scratch with our learning-oriented tutorials.

app_development_page_go_further.descript: Publish your app on the VTEX App Store and explore our recommended practices.
app_development_page_other_resources_com: The VTEX Community is an ecosystem where our clients and partners can interact, ask questions, and exchange information among themselves. It's the go-to place to find answers and talk about VTEX products.
app_development_page_other_resources_lea: The Learning Center contains courses about specific aspects of the IO platform and Store Framework.
app_development_page_other_resources_git: VTEX IO open-source apps and documentation are fully stored in the VTEX Apps Organization on GitHub.
app_development_page_other_resources_hel: The Help Center contains beginner tutorials, reference guides and troubleshooting articles about the VTEX Admin panel.
app_development_page_other_resources_sup: All clients have access to the services provided by our Technical Support team. These specialists are extensively prepared to give you the best experience possible when solving your tickets. To contact them, you need to open a ticket to VTEX support.

guides_card_subtitle: Explore VTEX core principles that shape language choices in content creation

guides_page_section.title: General
guides_page_section.content.0.title: Inclusive language
guides_page_section.content.0.descriptio: Learn how to use language that reflects diversity and promotes respectful, inclusive communication across all VTEX content
guides_page_section.content.1.title: Product and feature naming
guides_page_section.content.1.descriptio: Product and feature names should be clear, concise, and aligned with the VTEX identity. They help users quickly understand what a product or feature does.
guides_page_section.content.2.title: Tone of voice
guides_page_section.content.2.descriptio: Tone of voice ensures consistency in VTEX communication. It defines personality and style across all content, from UI elements to documentation.
guides_page_section.content.3.title: US English standard
guides_page_section.content.3.descriptio: Learn about US spelling patterns for writing VTEX content.
user_interfaces_page_section.title: General
user_interfaces_page_section.content.0.d: Action labels use up to three words to describe an action the user needs or wants to perform. This pattern is commonly seen in components such as Buttons and Menus.
user_interfaces_page_section.content.1.d: Content labels consist of up to three words to identify data properties and values. This pattern is typically found in components like Inputs, Tables, and Forms.
user_interfaces_page_section.content.2.d: Reference guide for applying consistent data formatting across VTEX content, including conventions for time, date, currency, and regional codes.
user_interfaces_page_section.content.3.d: Descriptions use a single sentence to clarify or explain complex information or tasks to the user.
user_interfaces_page_section.content.4.d: Messages consist of up to two sentences to communicate the system's current state and provide feedback on user actions. This pattern is commonly found in components such as Inputs or Alerts.
user_interfaces_page_section.content.5.d: Placeholder texts provide temporary guidance inside input fields. They should be concise and instructional and disappear when the user types.
user_interfaces_page_section.content.6.d: Titles should be concise and descriptive, following capitalization and formatting guidelines to ensure consistency across documentation and UI.
documentation_page_section_general.title: Documentation guidelines
documentation_page_section_general.conte: Explore ways to contribute to VTEX’s public documentation and help improve its quality and accessibility.
Learn how VTEX creates documentation and follow best practices to create clear, concise, and user-friendly content.
documentation_page_section_templates.con: Use this template to inform users about new features, improvements, bug fixes, and other product and system updates.
Use this template to guide users through, including installation, configuration, and usage.
Use this template to deliver clear, specific instructions for completing a task or achieving a goal.
Learn about the purpose of Known Issue articles, how they differ from other documentation types, and see an overview of a Known Issue article.
Use this template to introduce new users to a specific technology, tool, or system.
Use this template to inform users about updates, enhancements, and bug fixes in a new product version.
Use this template to provide practical solutions to common problems users may encounter while using the platform.
Use this template to provide step-by-step guidance on performing tasks or understanding complex concepts in detail.
formatting_page_section.title: General
formatting_page_section.content.0.title: Computer interfaces
formatting_page_section.content.0.descri: Learn how to reference and format UI elements such as placeholders, buttons, and icons for VTEX documentation.
formatting_page_section.content.1.title: Headings and titles
formatting_page_section.content.1.descri: Headings and titles name the content of an article and sections within it.
formatting_page_section.content.2.title: Lists and tables
formatting_page_section.content.2.descri: Lists and tables organize structured content, making it easier for users to scan and understand.
grammar_page_section.title: General
grammar_page_section.content.0.title: Abbreviations
grammar_page_section.content.0.descripti: Appropriately used abbreviations help keep content concise.
grammar_page_section.content.1.title: Adjectives
grammar_page_section.content.1.descripti: Use adjectives only when necessary to accurately describe products, features, or actions. Clear and precise descriptions make the text easier to read.
grammar_page_section.content.2.title: Articles
grammar_page_section.content.2.descripti: Articles should be used to improve readability and clarity. They should be omitted in certain UI elements for brevity.
grammar_page_section.content.3.title: Capitalization
grammar_page_section.content.3.descripti: Capitalization rules define when and how to capitalize words for clarity and consistency. This applies to UI elements, titles, and technical documentation.
grammar_page_section.content.4.title: Contractions
grammar_page_section.content.4.descripti: Contractions should be used carefully to maintain clarity and flow in the text. They can make the content sound more natural and approachable.
grammar_page_section.content.5.title: Pronouns
grammar_page_section.content.5.descripti: Pronouns should be used in a way that maintains clarity and inclusivity. They help make content more conversational and user-friendly.
grammar_page_section.content.6.title: Punctuation
grammar_page_section.content.6.descripti: Punctuation should be used consistently to clarify UI elements, documentation, and system messages. Proper punctuation enhances readability and avoids confusion.
grammar_page_section.content.7.title: Verbs
grammar_page_section.content.7.descripti: Verbs should be action-oriented and clear, guiding users through processes or instructions. They play a key role in UI text, documentation, and help content.
glossary_page_section.title: Glossary →
